intro: Acraea multiflora, commonly known as the African凤蝶, is a species of butterfly found in various parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Nymphalidae and is characterized by its striking wing patterns. The plant it interacts with, primarily certain species of flowering plants, serves as a host for its larvae. Acraea multiflora's life cycle is closely tied to the availability of these host plants. Its presence in an ecosystem can indicate the health and biodiversity of the surrounding flora.
